. version 16              // Set Version number for backward compatibility

. /* All required Stata packages are available in the /libraries/stata folder
> tokenize `"$S_ADO"', parse(";")
> while `"`1'"' != "" {
>   if `"`1'"'!="BASE" cap adopath - `"`1'"'
>   macro shift
> }
> adopath ++ "$working_ANALYSIS/scripts/libraries/stata"
> mata: mata mlib index

. * Create directories for output files
. cap mkdir "$working_ANALYSIS/processed"

. cap mkdir "$working_ANALYSIS/results"

. cap mkdir "$working_ANALYSIS/results/intermediate"

. cap mkdir "$working_ANALYSIS/results/tables"

. cap mkdir "$working_ANALYSIS/results/figures"

. 
. * Set general graph style
. set scheme swift_red //select one scheme as reference scheme to work with

. 
. 
. grstyle init 

. {
. *Background color
. grstyle set color white: background plotregion graphregion legend box textbox 
> //
. 
. *Main colors (note: swift_red only defines 8 colors. Multiplying the color, th
> at is "xx yy zz*0.5" reduces/increases intensity and "xx yy zz%50" reduces tra
> nsparency)
. grstyle set color       "100 143 255" "120 94 240" "220 38 127" "254 97 0" "25
> 5 176 0" /// 5 main colors
>                                         "100 143 255*0.4" "120 94 240*0.4" "22
> 0 38 127*0.4" "254 97 0*0.4" "255 176 0*0.4" ///
>                                         "100 143 255*1.7" "120 94 240*1.7" "22
> 0 38 127*1.7" "254 97 0*1.7" "255 176 0*1.7" ///
>                                         : p# p#line p#lineplot p#bar p#area p#
> arealine p#pie histogram 
. 
. *margins
. grstyle set compact
. 
. *Font size
. grstyle set size 10pt: heading //titles
. grstyle set size 8pt: subheading axis_title //axis titles
. grstyle set size 8pt: p#label p#boxlabel body small_body text_option axis_labe
> l tick_label minortick_label key_label //all other text
. 
. }

. // Sociodemographics
. * Education
. tab edu, generate(edu)

     Field in which |
  highes degree was |
           obtained |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.

                Law |         26        9.39       91.70
              Other |         23        8.30      100.00
--------------------+-----------------------------------
              Total |        277      100.00

. 
. * Organization currently working for
. gen orga = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace orga = 1 if organization == 1 | organization == 2 // International (11
> ) & national (168) gov orga 
(179 real changes made)

. replace orga = 2 if organization == 3 //  University/Research Institute
(33 real changes made)

. replace orga = 3 if organization == 5 //  Environmental NGO
(25 real changes made)

. replace orga = 4 if organization == 4 |  organization == 6 |  organization == 
> 7 //  Private Company (n=8), Non-environmental NGO (n=6), Other (n=26)
(40 real changes made)

. tab organization

         Type of organization |
        currently working for |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
  Internat. Gov. Organization |         11        3.97        3.97
       Nat. Gov. Organization |        168       60.65       64.62
University/Research Institute |         33       11.91       76.53
              Private Company |          8        2.89       79.42
            Environmental NGO |         25        9.03       88.45
        Non-Environmental NGO |          6        2.17       90.61
                        Other |         26        9.39      100.00
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
                        Total |        277      100.00

. lab define orga_lab 1 "Governmental Organization" 2 "University/Research Insti
> tute" 3 "Environmental NGO" 4 "Other"

. lab val orga orga_lab

. tab orga, gen(orga)

                         orga |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
    Governmental Organization |        179       64.62       64.62
University/Research Institute |         33       11.91       76.53
            Environmental NGO |         25        9.03       85.56
                        Other |         40       14.44      100.00
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
                        Total |        277      100.00

. // Temperature rise deemed acceptable
. ** Temperature above 1.5 degrees
. gen temp_above = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace temp_above = 0 if temp_rise <= 1.5
(216 real changes made)

. replace temp_above = 1 if temp_rise > 1.5
(61 real changes made)

. lab var temp_above "Temperature rise above 1.5°C deemed acceptable"

. 
. /*
> Very few people suggested temperatures of 2.5°C or higher to be acceptable:
> 2.5°C -> 9
> 3.0°C -> 4
> 3.5°C -> 2
> 4.0°C -> 2
> 4.5°C -> 0
> 5.0°C -> 4
> Therefore, for the illustration Figure 1a all temperature suggestions of 2.5°C
>  or more are summarized under >= 2.5°C
> */
. gen temp_rise2 = temp_rise

. replace temp_rise2 = 2.5 if temp_rise >= 2.5
(12 real changes made)

. tostring temp_rise2, gen(temp_rise3)
temp_rise3 generated as str3

. sort temp_rise

. lab define temp 1 "0" 2 ".5" 3 "1" 4 "1.5", replace

. encode temp_rise3, gen(temp_rise_cropped) lab(temp)

. lab var temp_rise_cropped"All those suggesting 2.5 or more collected in 2.5"

. drop temp_rise2 temp_rise3

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. // Global carbon price suggested
. ** Logarithmic form of suggested carbon prices
. gen ln_carbon_price = ln(carbon_price + 1)

. label var ln_carbon_price "Natural logarithm of suggested carbon_price"

. 
. ** Cropping carbon price suggested at 500 for visualization in figure 1a
. gen carbon_price_cap = carbon_price

. replace carbon_price_cap  = 501 if carbon_price > 500
(23 real changes made)

. egen mean_carbon_price = mean(carbon_price), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. egen median_carbon_price = median(carbon_price), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. tab temp_rise_cropped , gen(tr)

  All those |
 suggesting |
2.5 or more |
  collected |
     in 2.5 |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------+-----------------------------------
          0 |         22        7.94        7.94
         .5 |         36       13.00       20.94
          1 |         42       15.16       36.10
        1.5 |        116       41.88       77.98
          2 |         40       14.44       92.42
        2.5 |         21        7.58      100.00
------------+-----------------------------------
      Total |        277      100.00

. 
. ** Price suggested below 60 USD
. gen price_below = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace price_below = 0 if carbon_price >= 60 
(126 real changes made)

. replace price_below = 1 if carbon_price < 60 
(151 real changes made)

. lab var price_below "Price suggested < USD60"

. 
. /*
> Carbon price suggestions tested
> Different models suggest different minimal global carbon prices to stay below 
> a certain temperature rise. In the main paper we use USD60 as thte threshold. 
> As robustness test, we also test against other specifications: 82 USD, 185 USD
> , 281 USD
> */
. foreach i in 37 60 82 185 281 {
  2.         gen price_below_`i' = .
  3.                 replace price_below_`i'= 1 if carbon_price < `i'
  4.                 replace price_below_`i'= 0 if carbon_price >=  `i'
  5.         lab var price_below_`i' "Price below USD `i' suggested"
  6. }
(277 missing values generated)
(119 real changes made)
(158 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(151 real changes made)
(126 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(175 real changes made)
(102 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(224 real changes made)
(53 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(241 real changes made)
(36 real changes made)

. 
. ** Shifting
. // Other countries
. * To OECD
. gen shift_to_oecd = price_oecd_now - price_home_now 

. lab var shift_to_oecd "Shift to OECD Countries (if > 0 shift to others)" 

. * To LDCs
. gen shift_to_ldc = price_ldc_now - price_home_now 

. lab var shift_to_ldc "Shift to LD Countries (if > 0 shift to others)" 

. 
. * From LDC to OECD
. gen shift_ldc_oecd = price_oecd_now - price_ldc_now 

. lab var shift_ldc_oecd "Shift from LDC to OECD (if > 0 OECD-countries should p
> ay higher price)"

. 
. // Shifting responsibilties to the future
. * Home Country
. gen shift_future_home = price_home_future - price_home_now 

. lab var shift_future_home "Shift to future: Home (if>0 shift to future)" 

. * OECD Countries
. gen shift_future_oecd = price_oecd_future - price_oecd_now 

. lab var shift_future_oecd "Shift to future: OECD (if>0 shift to future)"

. * Least Developed Countries
. gen shift_future_ldc = price_ldc_future  - price_ldc_now

. lab var shift_future_ldc "Shift to future: Home (if>0 shift to future)"

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. // Region- and time-specific carbon price suggestions
. ** Logarithms of prices suggested prices for home, OECD, LDC / now, future
. foreach var in price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now price_home_future p
> rice_oecd_future price_ldc_future {
  2. gen ln_`var' = log(`var' + 1)
  3. }

. lab var ln_price_home_now "Ln of Price Home Now"

. lab var ln_price_oecd_now "Ln of Price OECD Now"

. lab var ln_price_ldc_now "Ln of Price LDCs Now"

. lab var ln_price_home_future "Ln of Price Home Future"

. lab var ln_price_oecd_future "Ln of Price OECD Future"

. lab var ln_price_ldc_future "Ln of Price LDCs Future"

. 
. ** Categorizing the ambitions of delegates for prices now and in the future
. gen ambition_home_fut = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace ambition_home_fut = 1 if price_home_now < 60  & price_home_future < 60
>   // Low ambition
(148 real changes made)

. replace ambition_home_fut = 2 if price_home_now < 60  & price_home_future >= 6
> 0 // Shift to future
(50 real changes made)

. replace ambition_home_fut = 3 if price_home_now >= 60 & price_home_future < 60
>   // Shift to now
(3 real changes made)

. replace ambition_home_fut = 4 if price_home_now >= 60 & price_home_future >= 6
> 0 // High ambition
(76 real changes made)

. lab define ambition_fut 1 "Low ambition" 2 "Future pay more" 3 "Now pay more" 
> 4 "High ambition", replace

. lab val ambition_home_fut ambition_fut

. 
. 
. 
. // Principal components
. ** Technological optimism

. lab var tech_ms_pca "Technological optimism mindset (PCA)"

. 
. * Winsorized variable of technological optimism (used for robustness test)
. winsor2 tech_ms_pca, suffix(_win) cuts(5 95)

.

. lab var negotiate_pca "PCA: Negotiations (higher values, higher agreement)"

. ** Negotiate own and other delgeation
. * Own delegation
. gen negotiate_pca_own = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace negotiate_pca_own = negotiate_pca if t_own_delegation == 1
(149 real changes made)

. 
. * Other delegation
. gen negotiate_pca_other = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace negotiate_pca_other = negotiate_pca if t_own_delegation == 0
(128 real changes made)

. **********               STRUCTURE             **********
. *********************************************************
. /*
> Main Body:
> I)  Fig. 1: Descriptives
>         a) Carbon price and temperature rise
>         b) Shifting the burden
> 
> II) Fig. 2: Inferential
>         a) Answers towards technological optimism items
>         b) Technological optimism mindset and temperature & prices suggested
> 
> III) In text-statistics not mentioned in the supplementary online material
>     - "Delegates vastly agree to limit global warming: The majority perceives 
> a rise above 1.5°C unacceptable (78%), with only few (8%) deeming an increase 
> of 2.5°C or more acceptable."
>     - "The median global carbon price recommended in our sample is 50 USD [...
> ]"
>     - "Roughly half of all delegates interviewed stated rather unambitious car
> bon prices below 60 USD (55%). Only 37% (19% and 13%, respectively) deemed a p
> rice of at least 82 USD (185 USD, 281 USD) as appropriate"
>     - "This variance in global price suggested is highest for the three low te
> mperature options (0°C, 0.5°C and 1°C), with price suggestions ranging from 0 
> to 2,000 USD (Levene’s test F(1, 275)=21.7, p<0.001)."
>     - "Of the 100 delegates [suggesting prices between 0°C und 1°C] in favor o
> f these ambitious temperature targets, 62% indicated global carbon prices belo
> w 60 USD as appropriate to stay below the temperature target."
>     - "In addition, we find that participants who claim to be influential in t
> heir delegation score higher on the technological optimism mindset (r=.23, p<.
> 001)."
> */
. 
. 
. use "$working_ANALYSIS\data\delegates_analysis.dta", clear

. 
. 
. *---------------------------------------
. *   I) FIGURE 1: Temperature rise deemed acceptable, carbon price suggested, a
> nd negotiation strategy applied
. *------------------------------
. // Figure Settings
. * Text size
. global head     10 // Title

. global legend    8 // Legend

. global xytitle   8 // Axis title

. global xylab     8 // Scale label

. 
. 
. // Fig 1a: Stripplot: Price and temperature rise 
. * Generate variable defining position of observations on x-axis
. egen carbon_price_rank = rank(carbon_price_cap), by(temp_rise_cropped) unique

. egen temp_rise_cropped_freq = count(carbon_price_cap), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. gen  temp_rise_cropped_jitter2 = temp_rise_cropped + (carbon_price_rank *.006)
>  - (temp_rise_cropped_freq / 2 * 0.006)

. 
. * Save number of observations in locals
. forvalues i = 1/6 {
  2. sum ln_carbon_price if tr`i' == 1
  3. local n_`i' = r(N)
  4. }

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         22    3.323065    2.261287          0   7.601402

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         36    3.722019    2.127395   .6931472   7.601402

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         42    4.207788    1.800718   1.098612   7.601402

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |        116    4.121002    1.359837          0   7.313887

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         40    3.659859    1.407166          0   6.552508

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         21    3.544467    1.325008   .6931472   6.908755

. twoway ///
> (scatter carbon_price_cap temp_rise_cropped_jitter2 , mcolor(%30) msize(medium
> ) msymbol(o))              ///
> (scatter mean_carbon_price temp_rise_cropped , mcolor(538g) msymbol(triangle))
>                                   ///
> (scatter median_carbon_price temp_rise_cropped , mcolor(538r) msymbol(square))
>                                   ///
> , title("{bf:a }", pos(11) span size($head pt))                               
>                            ///
> ytitle("Global carbon price (USD/tCO2)", size($xytitle pt))                   
>                            ///
> ylabel(, labsize($xylab pt))                                                  
>                            ///
> xtitle("Temperature rise deemed acceptable (°C)", size($xytitle pt)  margin(0 
> 0 0 4))                    ///
> xlabel(1 `" "0°C" "(n=`n_1')" "' 2 `" "0.5°C" "(n=`n_2')" "'  3 `" "1°C" "(n=`
> n_3')" "' 4 `" "1.5°C" "(n=`n_4')" "' 5 `" "2°C" "(n=`n_5')" "' 6 `" "{&ge}2.5
> °C" "(n=`n_6')" "' , labsize(2.5 pt))                                         
>        ///
> legend(order(1 "Observation" 2 "Mean" 3 "Median") size($legend pt) rows(3) pos
> (6) ring(1) region(fcolor(%40)))
(note:  named style 538g not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538g not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538r not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538r not found in class color, default attributes used)

. graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\price_temprise", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Doni
> a_Delegates\8_Submission\analysis\results\intermediate\price_temprise.gph save
> d)

. graph export "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\price_temprise.tif", repl
> ace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Doni
> a_Delegates\8_Submission\analysis\results\intermediate\price_temprise.tif writ
> ten in TIFF format)

. 
. 
. // Fig. 1b: Shifting the burden to other countries and the future (Descriptive
> s)
. preserve

. 
. ** Save number of observations per income-level in local
. forvalues i = 1/4 {
  2. sum income_level if income_level == `i'
  3. local n_`i' = r(N)
  4. }

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
income_level |         50           1           0          1          1

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
income_level |        103           2           0          2          2

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
income_level |         56           3           0          3          3

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
income_level |         68           4           0          4          4

. 
. ** Collpase observations to receive median
. collapse (median) price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now price_home_futur
> e price_oecd_future price_ldc_future , by(income_level)

. 
. ** Reshaping dataset from wide to long
. foreach var in price_home price_oecd price_ldc {
  2. rename `var'_now `var'1
  3. rename `var'_future `var'2
  4. }

. reshape long price_home price_oecd price_ldc, i(income_level) j(now_future)
(note: j = 1 2)

Data                               wide   ->   long
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of obs.                        4   ->       8
Number of variables                   7   ->       5
j variable (2 values)                     ->   now_future
xij variables:
                price_home1 price_home2   ->   price_home
                price_oecd1 price_oecd2   ->   price_oecd
                  price_ldc1 price_ldc2   ->   price_ldc
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

. lab define now_future 1 "Now" 2 "Future"

. lab val now_future now_future

. gen income_level_future = .
(8 missing values generated)

. replace income_level_future  = income_level if now_future == 1
(4 real changes made)

. replace income_level_future  = income_level + .25 if now_future == 2
(4 real changes made)

. 
. ** Draw figure
. global y = -6

. twoway ///
>         rspike price_home price_oecd income_level if now_future == 1, vertical
>  lwidth(vthick) lcolor(538y%25) xlabel(0(25)150)          || /// Now: Home-OEC
> D
>         rspike price_home price_ldc income_level if now_future == 1, vertical 
> lwidth(vthick) lcolor(538bs1%25) xlabel(0(25)150)         || /// Now: Home-LDC
>         rspike price_home price_oecd income_level_future if now_future == 2, v
> ertical lwidth(vthick) lcolor(538y%25) xlabel(0(25)150)   || /// Future: Home-
> OECD
>         rspike price_home price_ldc income_level_future  if now_future == 2, v
> ertical lwidth(vthick) lcolor(538bs1%25) xlabel(0(25)150) || /// Future: Home-
> LDC
>     scatter price_ldc  income_level if now_future == 1,  mcolor(538bs1%80)    
>        || /// Now: LDC
>         scatter price_home income_level if now_future == 1,  mcolor(538g%80)  
>            || /// Now: Home
>         scatter price_oecd income_level if now_future == 1,  mcolor(538y%80)  
>            || /// Now: OECD
>     scatter price_ldc  income_level_future if now_future == 2,  mcolor(538bs1%
> 80)      || /// Future: LDC
>         scatter price_home income_level_future if now_future == 2,  mcolor(538
> g%80)        || /// Future: Home
>         scatter price_oecd income_level_future if now_future == 2,  mcolor(538
> y%80)        || /// Future: OECDw-Future: LDC, High
>     line price_home income_level_future if income_level == 1,  lcolor(538g%40)
>   lpattern(dash) || /// Now-Future: Home, Low
>         line price_home income_level_future if income_level == 2,  lcolor(538g
> %40)  lpattern(dash) || /// Now-Future: Home, Low-Mid
>         line price_home income_level_future if income_level == 3,  lcolor(538g
> %40)  lpattern(dash) || /// Now-Future: Home, Upper-Mid
>         line price_home income_level_future if income_level == 4,  lcolor(538g
> %40)  lpattern(dash)    /// Now-Future: Home, High
>         title("{bf:b }", pos(11) span size($head pt))                         
>                                    ///
>         ytitle("Area-specific carbon price (median, in USD/tCO2)", size($xytit
> le pt))                            ///
>     ylabel(0 25 50 75 100 125 150, labsize($xylab pt) noticks nogrid) ymtick(2
> 5 50 75 100 125 150, grid)     ///
>         yline(0, lcolor(gs12%40) lpattern(solid))                             
>                                    ///
>         xtitle(Income level (country), size($xytitle pt) margin(0 0 0 4))     
>                                    ///
>         xlabel(1.125 `" "Low" "(n=`n_1')" "'  2.125 `" "Low-Mid" "(n=`n_2')" "
> ' 3.125 `" "Up-Mid" "(n=`n_3')" "' 4.125 `" "High" "(n=`n_4')" "', labsize(2.5
>  pt)) ///
>         ttext($y 1 "Now " $y 1.25 "Future" $y 2  "Now" $y 2.25 "Future" $y 3 "
> Now"  $y 3.25 "Future" $y 4 "Now" $y 4.25 "Future", orientation(vertical) plac
> ement(north) color(gs10) size(7pt)) /// Y X "Text"  
>                 legend(order(5 "Price LDC" 2 "Diff LDC-Home" 6 "Price Home" 11
>  "Diff Home Now-Future" 7 "Price OECD" 3 "Diff Home-OECD") cols(2) pos(6) ring
> (1) size($legend pt) region(fcolor(%40))) graphregion(fcolor(none))
(note:  named style 538y not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538y not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538bs1 not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538bs1 not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538y not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538y not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538bs1 not found in class color, default attributes used)
(note:  named style 538bs1 not found in class color, default attributes used)

    used)

. graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\shift_burden_by_incomelevel
> ", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Doni
> a_Delegates\8_Submission\analysis\results\intermediate\shift_burden_by_incomel
> evel.gph saved)

. graph export "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\shift_burden_by_incomelev
> el.tif", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Doni
> a_Delegates\8_Submission\analysis\results\intermediate\shift_burden_by_incomel
> evel.tif written in TIFF format)

. restore

. 
. // Combine Graph a and b
. graph combine "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\price_temprise"  "$worki
> ng_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\shift_burden_by_incomelevel", rows(1) scale(1
> .3) graphregion(margin(zero))

. *---------------------------------------
. *   II) FIGURE 2: The effect of technological optimism mindset on temperature 
> rise deemed acceptable, carbon prices, and strategic negotiation
. *------------------------------
. 
. // Fig 2: Inferential (Marginsplot)
. global head3     22 pt   // Title

. global legend3   18 pt   // Legend

. global xytitle3  20 pt   // Axis title

. global xylab3    20 pt   // Scale label

. global fysize    22 

. global textsize  14 pt

. 
. global pos_text1 -15 50

. global pos_text2  50 -4

. 
. 
. // Fig S2a: Distribution of answers towards technological optimism items
. 
. ** Catplot for each item
. global margins 145 0 1 3 // set margins for all

. mylabels 0(25)100, myscale(@) local(pctlabel) suffix("%") // set label for axi
> s
0 "0%" 25 "25%" 50 "50%" 75 "75%" 100 "100%"

. catplot tech_ms_1 , text($pos_text1 "Future generations will be richer and bet
> ter equipped to deal" "with adverse impacts of climate change." $pos_text2 "{i
> t:.42}", size($textsize) place(w) just(right)) stack percent asyvar yla(`pctla
> bel', nogrid)  title("") bargap(0) blabel(bar, size(medium) format(%9.0f) pos(
> center)) l1title("")  b1title("") legend(rows(1) pos(6) ring(1) size(vsmall)) 
> plotregion(margin(zero)) graphregion(margin($margins)) yscale(off) fysize($fys
> ize)

. graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt1", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Doni
> a_Delegates\8_Submission\analysis\results\intermediate\fut_opt1.gph saved)

. catplot tech_ms_2 , text($pos_text1  "Technological innovation e.g., solar geo
> engineering offers" "a suitable solution to respond in case of a future climat
> e emergency." $pos_text2 "{it:.47}", size($textsize) place(w) just(right)) sta
> ck percent asyvar yla(`pctlabel', nogrid)  title("") bargap(0) blabel(bar, siz
> e(medium) format(%9.0f) pos(center)) l1title("")  b1title("") legend(rows(1) p
> os(6) ring(1) size(vsmall)) plotregion(margin(zero)) graphregion(margin($margi
> ns)) yscale(off) fysize($fysize)

. graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt2", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Doni
> a_Delegates\8_Submission\analysis\results\intermediate\fut_opt2.gph saved)

. catplot tech_ms_3 , text($pos_text1  "The present costs and future benefits to
>  society must be weighed" "against each other, while deciding about emission r
> eduction policies." $pos_text2 "{it:.38}", size($textsize) place(w) just(right
> )) stack percent asyvar yla(`pctlabel', nogrid)  title("") bargap(0) blabel(ba
> r, size(medium) format(%9.0f) pos(center)) l1title("")  b1title("") legend(row
> s(1) pos(6) ring(1) size(vsmall)) plotregion(margin(zero)) graphregion(margin(
> $margins)) yscale(off) fysize($fysize)

. graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt3", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Doni
> a_Delegates\8_Submission\analysis\results\intermediate\fut_opt3.gph saved)

. catplot tech_ms_4 , text($pos_text1 "The usage of conventional energy sources 
> is inevitable as global" "energy demand is too high to be covered by renewable
>  energy." $pos_text2 "{it:.43}", size($textsize) place(w) just(right)) stack p
> ercent asyvar yla(`pctlabel', nogrid)  title("") bargap(0) blabel(bar, size(me
> dium) format(%9.0f) pos(center)) l1title("")  b1title("") legend(rows(1) pos(6
> ) ring(1) size(vsmall)) plotregion(margin(zero)) graphregion(margin($margins))
>  yscale(off) fysize($fysize)

. graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt4", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Doni

. catplot tech_ms_5 , text($pos_text1 "Technological innovations for climate cha
> nge emerge more likely in a" "free-market economy without much interference fr

> )) stack percent asyvar yla(`pctlabel', nogrid labsize(relative3)) ytitle("per

> 7.5 pt) symxsize(2.5)) plotregion(margin(zero)) graphregion(margin($margins)) 
> fysize(40)

> g the economy." $pos_text2 "{it:.37}" 180 2 "{it:Loading}" "{it:(PCA)}", size(
> $textsize) place(w) just(right)) stack percent asyvar yla(`pctlabel', nogrid) 
>  title("") bargap(0) blabel(bar, size(medium) format(%9.0f) pos(center)) l1tit
> le("")  b1title("") legend(rows(3) pos(6) ring(1) size(7.5 pt) rowgap(minuscul
> e) symxsize(2.5)) plotregion(margin(zero)) graphregion(margin($margins)) yscal
> e(off) fysize($fysize)

. ** Combine the single plots
. grc1leg "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt6" "$working_ANALYSIS\r
> esults\intermediate\fut_opt3" "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt2
> " "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt4" "$working_ANALYSIS\results
> \intermediate\fut_opt1" "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt5" , co
> ls(1) legendfrom("$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\fut_opt6") title("{bf
> :a }", size(11 pt) pos(11) ring(15)) graphregion(margin(2 3 -3 4)) plotregion(
> margin(0 0 0 5)) 

. gr_edit .legend.plotregion1.DragBy 1 35

. gr_edit .plotregion1.graph1.plotregion1.textbox3.style.editstyle horizontal(ce
> nter) editcopy

. gr_edit .plotregion1.graph1.plotregion1.textbox3.style.editstyle size(13) edit
> copy

. gr_edit .plotregion1.graph1.plotregion1.textbox2.style.editstyle size(13) edit
> copy

. gr_edit .plotregion1.graph2.plotregion1.textbox2.style.editstyle size(13) edit
> copy

. gr_edit .plotregion1.graph3.plotregion1.textbox2.style.editstyle size(13) edit
> copy

. gr_edit .plotregion1.graph4.plotregion1.textbox2.style.editstyle size(13) edit
> copy

. gr_edit .plotregion1.graph5.plotregion1.textbox2.style.editstyle size(13) edit
> copy

> essary 
. * Set globals
. global info_source info_cc_1 info_cc_2 info_cc_3 info_cc_4 info_cc_5

. global socioeconomics edu1 edu3 edu4 edu5 // Education ref. cat.: edu2 (Social
>  Sciences); gender and age erased to not jepardize anonimity of participants

. // "Roughly half of all delegates interviewed stated rather unambitious carbon
>  prices below 60 USD (55%). Only 37% (19% and 13%, respectively) deemed a pric
> e of at least 82 USD (185 USD, 281 USD) as appropriate"
. sum price_below_60 price_below_82 price_below_185 price_below_281

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
price_bel~60 |        277    .5451264    .4988607          0          1
price_bel~82 |        277     .631769    .4831975          0          1

. 
. // "This variance in global price suggested is highest for the three low tempe
> rature options (0°C, 0.5°C and 1°C), with price suggestions ranging from 0 to 
> 2,000 USD (Levene’s test F(1, 275)=21.7, p<0.001)."
. gen temp_rise1 = 0 

. replace temp_rise1 = 1 if temp_rise >=1.5
(177 real changes made)

. robvar ln_carbon_price, by(temp_rise1) // Robsut test for equality of variance
> s of logiritzmized carbon price across those suggesting a price of 0°C, 0.5°C 
> or 1°C as acceptable against the rest

            |   Summary of Natural logarithm of
            |       suggested carbon_price
 temp_rise1 |        Mean   Std. Dev.       Freq.
------------+------------------------------------
          0 |   3.8382722   2.0370112         100
          1 |   3.9483867   1.3800589         177
------------+------------------------------------
      Total |   3.9086341   1.6448975         277

W0  =  21.724332   df(1, 275)     Pr > F = 0.00000491

W50 =  19.055859   df(1, 275)     Pr > F = 0.00001799

W10 =  21.240064   df(1, 275)     Pr > F = 0.00000621

. 
. // "Of the 100 delegates [suggesting prices between 0°C und 1°C] in favor of t
> hese ambitious temperature targets, 62% indicated global carbon prices below 6
> 0 USD as appropriate to stay below the temperature target."
. sum price_below_60 if temp_rise <= 1

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
price_bel~60 |        100         .62    .4878317          0          1

. // S4.1 Temperature rise deemed acceptable [Regression underlying Fig 2b - blu
> e]
. ** Table S3: Effects of technological optimism mindset on temperature rise dee
> med acceptable.
. * Binary model [Temp-rise >= 2°C]
. probit temp_above tech_ms_pca  $info_source $orga cops_attended $socioeconomic
> s i.income, vce(robust)

. local pR2 = e(r2_p)

. testparm $info_source 

 ( 1)  [temp_above]info_cc_1 = 0
 ( 2)  [temp_above]info_cc_2 = 0
 ( 3)  [temp_above]info_cc_3 = 0
 ( 4)  [temp_above]info_cc_4 = 0
 ( 5)  [temp_above]info_cc_5 = 0

           chi2(  5) =    6.01
         Prob > chi2 =    0.3056

. local F1 = r(p)

. testparm $orga

 ( 1)  [temp_above]orga2 = 0
 ( 2)  [temp_above]orga3 = 0
 ( 3)  [temp_above]orga4 = 0

           chi2(  3) =    5.14
         Prob > chi2 =    0.1621

. local F2 = r(p)

. testparm $socioeconomics

 ( 1)  [temp_above]edu1 = 0
 ( 2)  [temp_above]edu3 = 0
 ( 3)  [temp_above]edu4 = 0
 ( 4)  [temp_above]edu5 = 0

           chi2(  4) =    4.75
         Prob > chi2 =    0.3137

. local F3 = r(p)

. margins , dydx(*) post

               2.income_level 3.income_level 4.income_level

. * Table S6: Effects of technological optimism mindset on global carbon prices 
> excluding participants naming ambitious temperature targets (≤1.5°C) and low g
> lobal carbon prices at the same time

  4. }

. * Fig S8b. Raincloud plot for principal component
. * Use egen to generate the median, quartiles, interquartile range (IQR), and m
> ean. 
. egen med_env = median(env_ms_pca)

. egen lqt_env = pctile(env_ms_pca), p(25)

. egen uqt_env = pctile(env_ms_pca), p(75)

. egen iqr_env = iqr(env_ms_pca)

. egen mean__env = mean(env_ms_pca)

. 
. * Find the lowest value that is more than lqt - 1.5 iqr (Lower whisker)
. egen ls_env = min(env_ms_pca)

. 
. * Find the highest value that is less than uqt + 1.5 iqr (Upper whisker)
. egen us_env = max(env_ms_pca)

. 
. * Set position of "raindrops" on x-axis by attributing ranodm values for x-axi
> s
. gen pos_rain_env = runiform(0.02,0.16)

. replace pos_rain_env = pos_rain * (-1)
(277 real changes made)

. 
. * Set position of Boxplot (In middle of "raindrops": between pos_rain)
. gen pos_box_env = -.09

. 
. global gray gs6

. global width medthick

. twoway ///
> kdensity env_ms_pca, recast(area) color(purple*1.5%50)   ||         /// Distri
> bution (Cloud)
> rbar lqt_env med_env pos_box_env, barw(.14) fcolor(white%0) lcolor($gray) lwid
> th($width) horizontal  || ///
> rbar med_env uqt_env pos_box_env, barw(.14) fcolor(white%0) lcolor($gray) lwid
> th($width) horizontal  ||  ///
> rspike lqt_env ls_env pos_box_env, lcolor($gray) lwidth($width) horizontal || 
>   ///
> rspike uqt_env us_env pos_box_env, lcolor($gray) lwidth($width) horizontal || 
>   ///
> scatter pos_rain_env env_ms_pca, color(purple*1.5%25) msize(small)    /// Sing
> le observation (Rain)
> , legend(off) yscale(off) ylabel(none) xlabel(-6(2)2, labsize($xylab3)) xtitle
> ("Environmental caution (PCA)", size($xytitle3)) yla(, labsize($xylab3))  titl
> e("{bf:b }" , size($head3)) graphregion(margin(17 17 0 0)) plotregion(margin(0
>  0 0 5)) fysize(40)

. *----------
. * III. Cleaning
. *----------------
. /*
> Three participants answered the survey twice; same e-mail adress twice in data
> set. For each couple, same name&lastname:
> 
> Date            firstname                               lastname              
>   email
> 04.11.2020      Ram Prasad                              Awasthi               
>   awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 16.02.2021      Ram                                             Awasthi       
>           awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 
> 02.12.2020      Nagla                                   Jebory                
>   nagla_fnc@yahoo.com
> 05.11.2020      Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain  Jebory                  nagla_fnc@yaho
> o.com
> 
> 06.11.2020      Augustin                                Ngenzirabona    augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 25.03.2021      Ngenzirablna                    Augustin                augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 
> Keep first entry of each
> */
. drop if firstname == "Ram" & lastname == "Awasthi"
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if firstname == "Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain" & lastname == "Jebory"
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if firstname == "Ngenzirablna" & lastname == "Augustin"
(1 observation deleted)

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. *** Generate ID
. gen id = _n

. lab var id "ID"

. 
. 
. *** i) Encoding
. ** veryimportant => very important; somewhatunimportant => somewhat unimportan
> t
. foreach var in ta1sq0011 ta1sq0021 ta1sq0031 ta1sq0041 ta1sq0051 {
  2. replace `var'="Very important" if `var'=="Veryimportant"
  3. replace `var'="Somewhat unimportant" if `var'== "Somewhatunimportant"
  4. replace `var'="Not important at all" if `var'== "Notimportant at all"
  5. }
(161 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0011 was str19 now str20
(4 real changes made)
(7 real changes made)
(219 real changes made)

(1 real change made)
(0 real changes made)
(190 real changes made)

(2 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)
(157 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0041 was str19 now str20
(8 real changes made)
(6 real changes made)
(144 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0051 was str19 now str20
(10 real changes made)
(4 real changes made)

. 
. ** Importance of environmental projection
. label define important 1 "Not important at all" 2 "Somewhat unimportant" 3 "Ne
> utral" 4 "Somewhat important" 5 "Very important"

. foreach var in ta1sq0011 ta1sq0021 ta1sq0031 ta1sq0041 ta1sq0051 {
  2. encode `var', gen(`var'_enc) label(important)
  3. }

. 
. rename ta1sq0011_enc env_ms_1

. label var env_ms_1 "Environmental events that historically happened once per c
> entury will occur at least once per year by 2050."
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0021_enc env_ms_2

. label var env_ms_2 "Besides greenhouse gas emissions, the earth is approaching

. lab def conti 1 "Africa" 2 "Asia" 3 "Europe" 4 "North America" 5 "South Americ
> a" 6 "Oceania", replace

. encode continent, gen(continent2) lab(conti)

. drop continent

. rename continent2 continent

. lab var continent "Continent"

> ty topics"

> c_social == 0 & educ_social_nat == 0 & educ_engin == 0 & educ_other == 0
> replace educ_other = 0 if educ_nat != 0 | educ_econ != 0 | educ_law != 0 | edu
> c_social != 0 | educ_social_nat != 0 | educ_engin != 0 | educ_other != 0
> 
> gen educ_type = .
> replace educ_type = 1 if educ_nat == 1
> replace educ_type = 2 if educ_econ == 1 
> replace educ_type = 3 if educ_social == 1
> replace educ_type = 4 if educ_social_nat == 1
> replace educ_type = 5 if educ_law == 1
> replace educ_type = 6 if educ_engin == 1
> replace educ_type = 7 if educ_other == 1
> lab var educ_type "Education type"
> lab define educ_type1 1 "Natural sciences" 2 "Economics/Business" 3 "Other soc
> ial sciences" 4 "Mix social & natural sciences" 5 "Law" 6 "Engineering" 7 "Oth
> er"
> lab val educ_type educ_type1
> 
> 
> keep id edu_specify educ_type educ_nat educ_econ educ_law educ_social educ_soc
> ial_nat educ_engin educ_other env_cli_sust
> 
> save "$datapath\edu_classification.dta", replace
> 
> 
>

> use "$datapath\delegates_clean1.dta", clear
> merge 1:1 id using "$datapath\edu_classification.dta", force
>

> drop _merge
> */

. // World development indices
. *import excel "$xls\WDI_Indexes_average 2015-2019", sheet("Sheet1") firstrow c
> ase(lower) clear
. 
. import excel "$xls\Data_Extract_From_World_Development_Indicators", sheet("Dat
> a") firstrow case(lower) clear
(9 vars, 1,601 obs)

. foreach var in yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019 {
  2. replace `var' = "." if `var' == ".."
  3. }
(325 real changes made)
(333 real changes made)
(333 real changes made)
(336 real changes made)
(581 real changes made)

. destring yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019, replace
yr2015: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(330 missing values generated)
yr2016: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(338 missing values generated)
yr2017: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(338 missing values generated)
yr2018: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(341 missing values generated)
yr2019: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(586 missing values generated)

. encode countrycode, generate(country_code)

. egen average = rowmean(yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019)
(329 missing values generated)

. keep countryname average seriesname

. drop if countryname == ""
(3 observations deleted)

. 
. * Reshape to wide
. egen indicator = group(seriesname)
(2 missing values generated)

. drop if indicator == . // Datasource information
(2 observations deleted)

. 
. /* 
> 1: CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)       
> 2: Droughts, floods, extreme temperatures (% of population, average 1990-2009)
> 3: GDP (constant 2015 US$); 
> 4: GDP growth (annual %)
> 5: GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)
> 6: Population, total
> */
. 
. drop seriesname 

. encode countryname , gen(country_code)

. reshape wide average , i(country_code) j(indicator)
(note: j = 1 2 3 4 5 6)

Data                               long   ->   wide
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of obs.                     1596   ->     266
Number of variables                   4   ->       8
j variable (6 values)         indicator   ->   (dropped)
xij variables:
                                average   ->   average1 average2 ... average6
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

. 
. * Unify variable names
. rename countryname country_home

. label var country_home "Home country"

. drop country_code

. order country_home

. 
. rename average1 co2_emissionpc

. label var co2_emissionpc "CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)"

. 
. drop average2 // no values for countries in dataset

. 
. rename average3 gdp

. label var gdp "GDP (constant 2015 US$)"

. 
. rename average4 gdp_growth

. label var gdp_growth "GDP growth (annual %)"

. 
. rename average5 gdppc

. label var gdppc "GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)"

. 
. rename average6 population

. label var population "Population, total"

. 
. 
. 
. * Unify country names
. replace country_home = "Congo" if country_home == "Congo, Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Czechia" if country_home == "Czech Republic"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Democratic Republic of the Congo" if country_home == "
> Congo, Dem. Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Egypt" if country_home == "Egypt, Arab Rep."

> untry_home == "Côte d'Ivoire"

    matched                               192

    matched                               192

    Result                           # of obs.
    -----------------------------------------
    not matched                             0
    matched                               192  
    -----------------------------------------

. merge 1:1 name using "$datapath\NDGAIN_gain.dta", nogenerate

    Result                           # of obs.
    -----------------------------------------
    not matched                             0
    matched                               192  
    -----------------------------------------

. label values resource_rich resource_rich1

. ** Income Levels (World Bank Reference)
. import excel "$xls\Historical_Income_Levels.xlsx", sheet("Country Analytical H
> istory") cellrange(A4:AK240) firstrow clear
(37 vars, 236 obs)

.

. keep country_home income_level_orig

. drop in 1/7
(7 observations deleted)

. drop in 228/229
(2 observations deleted)

. drop if country_home == ""
(2 observations deleted)

. * Income Level
. gen income_level = .
(225 missing values generated)

. replace income_level = 1 if income_level_orig == "L"
(27 real changes made)

. replace income_level = 2 if income_level_orig == "LM"
(55 real changes made)

. replace income_level = 3 if income_level_orig == "UM"
(55 real changes made)

. replace income_level = 4 if income_level_orig == "H"
(80 real changes made)

. label var income_level "Classification 2020: Low<$1,045; 1,046<lower-middle<4,
> 095; 4,096<upper-middle<12,695; high>12,696"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. label define income_levell 1 "Low" 2 "Low-middle" 3 "Upper-middle" 4 "High", r
> eplace

. label values income_level income_levell

. 
. gen low_income=.
(225 missing values generated)

. replace low_income=1 if income_level==1
(27 real changes made)

. replace low_income=0 if income_level!=1 & income_level!= .
(190 real changes made)

. label var low_income "Low income countries"

. label define low_income 0 "No low-income" 1 "low-income", replace

. label values low_income low_income

. 
. gen lower_middle_income=.
(225 missing values generated)

. replace lower_middle_income=1 if income_level==2
(55 real changes made)

. replace lower_middle_income=0 if income_level!= 2 & income_level!= .
(162 real changes made)

. label var lower_middle_income "Lower-middle income countries"

. label define lower_middle_income 0 "No lower-middle" 1 "lower-middle", replace

. label values lower_middle_income lower_middle_income

. 
. gen upper_middle_income=.
(225 missing values generated)

. replace upper_middle_income=1 if income_level==3
(55 real changes made)

. replace upper_middle_income=0 if income_level!= 3 & income_level!=. 
(162 real changes made)

. label var upper_middle_income "Upper-middle income countries"

. label define upper_middle_income 0 "No upper-middle" 1 "Upper-middle", replace

. label values upper_middle_income upper_middle_income

. 
. gen high_income=.
(225 missing values generated)

. replace high_income=1 if income_level==4
(80 real changes made)

. replace high_income=0 if income_level!= 4 & income_level!= .
(137 real changes made)

. label var high_income "High income countries"

. label define high_income 0 "No high-income" 1 "High-income", replace

. label values high_income high_income

. 
. * Unify country names
. replace country_home = "Congo" if country_home == "Congo, Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Democratic Republic of the Congo" if country_home == "
> Congo, Dem. Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Gambia" if country_home == "The Gambia"
(0 real changes made)

. replace country_home = "Egypt" if country_home == "Egypt, Arab Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Gambia" if country_home == "Gambia, The"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Lao People's Democratic Republic" if country_home == "
> Lao PDR"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Micronesia" if country_home == "Micronesia, Fed. Sts."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Republic of Korea" if country_home == "Korea, Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Czechia" if country_home == "Czech Republic"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Côte d’Ivoire" if country_home == "Cote d'Ivoire" | co
> untry_home == "Côte d'Ivoire"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "United States of America" if country_home == "United S
> tates" 
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Viet Nam" if country_home == "Vietnam" 
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Kyrgyzstan" if country_home == "Kyrgyz Republic"
(1 real change made)

> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\income_level.dta saved

>  firstrow case(lower) clear
(6 vars, 276 obs)

. *WDI

(note: variable country_home was str32, now str52 to accommodate using data's
       values)

    Result                           # of obs.
    -----------------------------------------
    not matched                           156
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                        156  (_merge==2)

    matched                               277  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. *ed country_home _merge if _merge == 1
. drop if _merge == 2
(156 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. sum gdp gdppc gdp_growth co2_emissionpc population 

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
         gdp |        277    5.49e+11    1.91e+12   3.25e+08   1.91e+13
       gdppc |        277    13773.67    24223.47   289.2979   170379.2
  gdp_growth |        276    3.281068    2.540942   -7.16189   10.02113

  population |        277    4.63e+07    1.02e+08    37772.6   1.39e+09

.

> on_Prices\STATA\DO-FILES\00 - Cleaning.do"

. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Donia Delegates
. * 00 clean.do
. * START: 2021-01-24
. * Authors: Max Burger

. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Program Setup
. *--------------------------------------------------
. clear all               

. *version 16              // Set Version number for backward compatibility
. set more off            

. set linesize 80         

. macro drop _all        

. set matsize 2000
set matsize ignored.
    Matrix sizes are no longer limited by c(matsize) in modern Statas.  Matrix
    sizes are now limited by flavor of Stata.  See limits for more details.

. * -------------------------------------------------
. 
. 
. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Directory
. *--------------------------------------------------
. 
. * Max (G-Drive)
. global stata "C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delega
> tes\4_Carbon_Prices\STATA"

. global workpath   "$stata\DO-FILES"

. global datapath   "$stata\DTA-FILES"

. global output     "$stata\OUTPUT"

. global xls        "$stata\XLS-FILES"

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Description
. *--------------------------------------------------
. /*
> I) Importing files
> II) Appending files to one dataset
> III) Cleaning
>         i) Renaming & Encoding
> IV) Unifying country-names and assigning to continents
> V) Merge country-specifics
> */
. *--------------------------------------------------
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. *--------
. * I. Importing files
. *-------------
. *** Treatment 1: Environment
. ** Own delegation
. import excel "$xls\Ecological-Own delegation.xlsx", firstrow case(lower) clear
(115 vars, 69 obs)

. 
. gen t_env=1

. label variable t_env "Primed on environmetnal caution (1) compared to techn. o
> pt. (0)"

. label define treatment_env 1 "Envir. caut" 0 "Tech. Opt"

. label values t_env treatment_env

. 
. gen t_own_delegation=1

. label variable t_own_delegation "Asked on own delegation (1) or others delegat
> ion (0)"

. label define treatment_delegation 1 "Own delegation" 0 "Other delegation"

. label values t_own_delegation treatment_delegation

. 
. save "$datapath\delegates_ecol_own.dta", replace
(note: file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\
> 4_Carbon_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_own.dta not found)
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_own.dta saved

. 
. 
.

. ** Others delegation
. import excel "$xls\Ecological-Other delegation.xlsx", firstrow case(lower) cle
> ar
(115 vars, 60 obs)

.

.

> ion (0)"

. label values t_own_delegation treatment_delegation

. * II. Appending & merging
. *--------------------
. use "$datapath\delegates_ecol_own.dta", clear

. append using "$datapath\delegates_ecol_others.dta", force
(note: variable a3sq002 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable b4sq004 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd14sq001_sq001 was str21, now str32 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd14sq002_sq001 was str18, now str29 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd6sq004 was str2, now str3 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd6sq006 was str2, now str3 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd6other was str44, now str168 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable lastname was str16, now str30 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. append using "$datapath\delegates_econ_own.dta", force
(note: variable a3sq003 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable ta1sq0031 was str18, now str19 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd1other was str86, now str103 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd3other was str50, now str62 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd571057comment was str53, now str98 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd571058comment was str36, now str41 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5othercomment was str34, now str60 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. append using "$datapath\delegates_econ_others.dta", force
(note: variable sd1 was str6, now str17 to accommodate using data's values)
(note: variable sd14sq002_sq001 was str29, now str32 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5sq001comment was str69, now str105 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5othercomment was str60, now str81 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. 
.

. *----------
. * III. Cleaning
. *----------------
. /*
> Three participants answered the survey twice; same e-mail adress twice in data
> set. For each couple, same name&lastname:
> 
> Date            firstname                               lastname              
>   email
> 04.11.2020      Ram Prasad                              Awasthi               
>   awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 16.02.2021      Ram                                             Awasthi       
>           awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 
> 02.12.2020      Nagla                                   Jebory                
>   nagla_fnc@yahoo.com
> 05.11.2020      Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain  Jebory                  nagla_fnc@yaho
> o.com
> 
> 06.11.2020      Augustin                                Ngenzirabona    augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 25.03.2021      Ngenzirablna                    Augustin                augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
>

  3. replace `var'="Somewhat unimportant" if `var'== "Somewhatunimportant"
  4. replace `var'="Not important at all" if `var'== "Notimportant at all"
  5. }

(26 real changes made)

. label define orga 1 "Internat. Gov. Organization" 2 "Nat. Gov. Organization" 3
>  "University/Research Institute" 4 "Private Company" 5 "Environmental NGO" 6 "
> Non-Environmental NGO" 7 "Other"

. label values organization orga

. label variable organization "Type of organization currently working for"

. 
. rename sd6other organization_other

. label variable organization_other "Other"

.

>  influential" 99 "Don’t know"

> n the last COP?"

. * Treatment

> ion)"

> ial sciences" 4 "Mix social & natural sciences" 5 "Law" 6 "Engineering" 7 "Oth
> er"

. // World development indices
. *import excel "$xls\WDI_Indexes_average 2015-2019", sheet("Sheet1") firstrow c
> ase(lower) clear
. 
. import excel "$xls\Data_Extract_From_World_Development_Indicators", sheet("Dat
> a") firstrow case(lower) clear
(9 vars, 1,601 obs)

. foreach var in yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019 {
  2. replace `var' = "." if `var' == ".."
  3. }
(325 real changes made)
(333 real changes made)
(333 real changes made)
(336 real changes made)
(581 real changes made)

. destring yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019, replace
yr2015: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(330 missing values generated)
yr2016: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(338 missing values generated)
yr2017: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(338 missing values generated)
yr2018: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(341 missing values generated)
yr2019: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(586 missing values generated)

. encode countrycode, generate(country_code)

. egen average = rowmean(yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019)
(329 missing values generated)

. keep countryname average seriesname

. drop if countryname == ""
(3 observations deleted)

. 
. * Reshape to wide
. egen indicator = group(seriesname)
(2 missing values generated)

. drop if indicator == . // Datasource information
(2 observations deleted)

. 
. /* 
> 1: CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)       
> 2: Droughts, floods, extreme temperatures (% of population, average 1990-2009)
> 3: GDP (constant 2015 US$); 
> 4: GDP growth (annual %)
> 5: GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)
> 6: Population, total
> */
. 
. drop seriesname 

. encode countryname , gen(country_code)

. reshape wide average , i(country_code) j(indicator)
(note: j = 1 2 3 4 5 6)

Data                               long   ->   wide
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of obs.                     1596   ->     266
Number of variables                   4   ->       8
j variable (6 values)         indicator   ->   (dropped)
xij variables:
                                average   ->   average1 average2 ... average6
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

. 
. * Unify variable names
. rename countryname country_home

. label var country_home "Home country"

. drop country_code

. order country_home

. 
. rename average1 co2_emissionpc

. label var co2_emissionpc "CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)"

. 
. drop average2 // no values for countries in dataset

. 
. rename average3 gdp

. label var gdp "GDP (constant 2015 US$)"

. 
. rename average4 gdp_growth

. label var gdp_growth "GDP growth (annual %)"

. 
. rename average5 gdppc

. label var gdppc "GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)"

. 
. rename average6 population

. label var population "Population, total"

. 
. 
.

. replace country_home = "Congo" if country_home == "Congo, Rep."

    not matched                             0
    matched                               192  
    -----------------------------------------

. // Other country-specifics: Fuelt-exporting; OECD/LDC
. /*
> Originally Donia categorized countries manually. In order to make this classif
> ication fit in this do-file, Max deduces the countryspecifics from the .dta an
> d merges it with this dataset.
> */
. import excel "$xls\OECD_LDC_G77_OIL_RESS", sheet("Tabelle1") firstrow case(low
> er) clear
(6 vars, 110 obs)

. 
. * Fuel Exporting
. lab var fuel_exporting "Fuel exporting country"

. label define fuel_exporting1 0 "Non fuel-exporting" 1 "Fuel-exporting", replac
> e

. label values fuel_exporting fuel_exporting1

. 
. * OECD
. lab var oecd "OECD"

. label define OECD1 0 "Not in OECD" 1 "In OECD", replace

. label values oecd OECD1

. 
. * LDC
. lab var ldc "LDC"

. label define LDC1 0 "No LDC" 1 "LDC", replace

. label values ldc LDC1

. 
. * Resource-rich
. lab var resource_rich "Resource-rich country"

. label define resource_rich1 0 "Non resource-rich" 1 "Resource-rich", replace

. label values resource_rich resource_rich1

. 
. * G77 group countries
. label var g77 "G77 member states at the UN"

. label define G771 0 "Non-G77" 1 "G77", replace

. label values g77  G771

. 
. save "$datapath\country-specifics.dta", replace
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\country-specifics.dta saved

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. ** Income Levels (World Bank Reference)
. import excel "$xls\Historical_Income_Levels.xlsx", sheet("Country Analytical H
> istory") cellrange(A4:AK240) firstrow clear
(37 vars, 236 obs)

. 
. rename B country_home

. rename AJ income_level_orig

. keep country_home income_level_orig

. drop in 1/7
(7 observations deleted)

. drop in 228/229
(2 observations deleted)

. drop if country_home == ""
(2 observations deleted)

. 
. * Income Level
. gen income_level = .
(225 missing values generated)

. replace income_level = 1 if income_level_orig == "L"
(27 real changes made)

. replace income_level = 2 if income_level_orig == "LM"
(55 real changes made)

. replace income_level = 3 if income_level_orig == "UM"
(55 real changes made)

. replace income_level = 4 if income_level_orig == "H"
(80 real changes made)

. label var income_level "Classification 2020: Low<$1,045; 1,046<lower-middle<4,
> 095; 4,096<upper-middle<12,695; high>12,696"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. label define income_levell 1 "Low" 2 "Low-middle" 3 "Upper-middle" 4 "High", r
> eplace

. label values income_level income_levell

. 
. gen low_income=.
(225 missing values generated)

. replace low_income=1 if income_level==1
(27 real changes made)

. replace low_income=0 if income_level!=1 & income_level!= .
(190 real changes made)

. label var low_income "Low income countries"

. label define low_income 0 "No low-income" 1 "low-income", replace

. label values low_income low_income

. 
. gen lower_middle_income=.
(225 missing values generated)

. replace lower_middle_income=1 if income_level==2
(55 real changes made)

. replace lower_middle_income=0 if income_level!= 2 & income_level!= .
(162 real changes made)

. label var lower_middle_income "Lower-middle income countries"

. label define lower_middle_income 0 "No lower-middle" 1 "lower-middle", replace

. label values lower_middle_income lower_middle_income

. 
. gen upper_middle_income=.
(225 missing values generated)

. replace upper_middle_income=1 if income_level==3
(55 real changes made)

. replace upper_middle_income=0 if income_level!= 3 & income_level!=. 
(162 real changes made)

. label var upper_middle_income "Upper-middle income countries"

. label define upper_middle_income 0 "No upper-middle" 1 "Upper-middle", replace

. label values upper_middle_income upper_middle_income

. 
. gen high_income=.
(225 missing values generated)

. replace high_income=1 if income_level==4
(80 real changes made)

. replace high_income=0 if income_level!= 4 & income_level!= .
(137 real changes made)

. label var high_income "High income countries"

. label define high_income 0 "No high-income" 1 "High-income", replace

. label values high_income high_income

. 
. * Unify country names
. replace country_home = "Congo" if country_home == "Congo, Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Democratic Republic of the Congo" if country_home == "
> Congo, Dem. Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Gambia" if country_home == "The Gambia"
(0 real changes made)

. replace country_home = "Egypt" if country_home == "Egypt, Arab Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Gambia" if country_home == "Gambia, The"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Lao People's Democratic Republic" if country_home == "
> Lao PDR"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Micronesia" if country_home == "Micronesia, Fed. Sts."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Republic of Korea" if country_home == "Korea, Rep."
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Czechia" if country_home == "Czech Republic"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Côte d’Ivoire" if country_home == "Cote d'Ivoire" | co
> untry_home == "Côte d'Ivoire"
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "United States of America" if country_home == "United S
> tates" 
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Viet Nam" if country_home == "Vietnam" 
(1 real change made)

. replace country_home = "Kyrgyzstan" if country_home == "Kyrgyz Republic"
(1 real change made)

. 
. *---Save Income Levels---*
. save "$datapath\income_level.dta", replace
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\income_level.dta saved

. 
.

.

. ** Delegation-Country (from the COP-Report)
. import excel "C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delega
> tes\4_Carbon_Prices\STATA\XLS-FILES\delegates_ctry_orga.xlsx", sheet("Sheet1")
>  firstrow case(lower) clear
(6 vars, 276 obs)

. rename country country_delegation 

. lab var country_delegation  "Delegation for which participant has been at COP"

. keep firstname lastname country_delegation 

. 
. *---Save Delegation ---*
. save "$datapath\delegation.dta", replace
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegation.dta saved

.

. // MERGE
. use  "$datapath\delegates_clean2.dta", clear

. 
. *WDI
. merge m:1 country_home using "$datapath\WDI.dta" // 
(note: variable country_home was str32, now str52 to accommodate using data's
       values)

    Result                           # of obs.
    -----------------------------------------
    not matched                           156
        from master                         0  (_merge==1)
        from using                        156  (_merge==2)

    matched                               277  (_merge==3)
    -----------------------------------------

. *ed country_home _merge if _merge == 1
. drop if _merge == 2
(156 observations deleted)

. drop _merge

. sum gdp gdppc gdp_growth co2_emissionpc population 

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
         gdp |        277    5.49e+11    1.91e+12   3.25e+08   1.91e+13
       gdppc |        277    13773.67    24223.47   289.2979   170379.2
  gdp_growth |        276    3.281068    2.540942   -7.16189   10.02113
co2_emissi~c |        276     3.16996    3.705128   .0295574   21.25095
  population |        277    4.63e+07    1.02e+08    37772.6   1.39e+09

.

    Result                           # of obs.

        from master                         0  (_merge==1)

    matched                               277  (_merge==3)

. drop if _merge == 2

. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Donia Delegates
. * 00 clean.do

. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Program Setup
. *--------------------------------------------------
. clear all               

. *version 16              // Set Version number for backward compatibility
. set more off            

. set linesize 80         

. macro drop _all        

. set matsize 2000
set matsize ignored.
    Matrix sizes are no longer limited by c(matsize) in modern Statas.  Matrix
    sizes are now limited by flavor of Stata.  See limits for more details.

. * -------------------------------------------------
. 
. 
. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Directory
. *--------------------------------------------------
. 
. * Max (G-Drive)
. global stata "C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delega
> tes\4_Carbon_Prices\STATA"

. global workpath   "$stata\DO-FILES"

. global datapath   "$stata\DTA-FILES"

. global output     "$stata\OUTPUT"

. global xls        "$stata\XLS-FILES"

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Description
. *--------------------------------------------------
. /*
> I) Importing files
> II) Appending files to one dataset
> III) Cleaning
>         i) Renaming & Encoding
> IV) Unifying country-names and assigning to continents
> V) Merge country-specifics
> */
. *--------------------------------------------------
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. *--------
. * I. Importing files
. *-------------
. *** Treatment 1: Environment
. ** Own delegation
. import excel "$xls\Ecological-Own delegation.xlsx", firstrow case(lower) clear
(115 vars, 69 obs)

. 
. gen t_env=1

. label variable t_env "Primed on environmetnal caution (1) compared to techn. o
> pt. (0)"

. label define treatment_env 1 "Envir. caut" 0 "Tech. Opt"

. label values t_env treatment_env

. 
. gen t_own_delegation=1

. label variable t_own_delegation "Asked on own delegation (1) or others delegat
> ion (0)"

. label define treatment_delegation 1 "Own delegation" 0 "Other delegation"

. label values t_own_delegation treatment_delegation

. 
. save "$datapath\delegates_ecol_own.dta", replace
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_own.dta saved

. 
. 
. 
. 
. ** Others delegation
. import excel "$xls\Ecological-Other delegation.xlsx", firstrow case(lower) cle
> ar
(115 vars, 60 obs)

. 
. gen t_env=1

. label variable t_env "Primed on ecological (1) or economic (0) consequences"

. label define treatment_env 1 "Ecologic" 0 "Economic"

. label values t_env treatment_env

. 
. gen t_own_delegation=0

. label variable t_own_delegation "Asked on own delegation (1) or others delegat
> ion (0)"

. label define treatment_delegation 1 "Own delegation" 0 "Other delegation"

. label values t_own_delegation treatment_delegation

. 
. save "$datapath\delegates_ecol_others.dta", replace
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_others.dta saved

. 
. 
. *** Treatment 2: Economy
. ** Own delegation
. import excel "$xls\Economic-Own delegation.xlsx", firstrow case(lower) clear
(115 vars, 82 obs)

. 
. gen t_env=0

. label variable t_env "Primed on ecological (1) or economic (0) consequences"

. label define treatment_env 1 "Ecologic" 0 "Economic"

. label values t_env treatment_env

.

. ** Others delegation

(115 vars, 69 obs)

. 
. gen t_env=0

. label define treatment_env 1 "Ecologic" 0 "Economic"

. label values t_env treatment_env

.

. *------------
. * II. Appending & merging
. *--------------------
. use "$datapath\delegates_ecol_own.dta", clear

. append using "$datapath\delegates_ecol_others.dta", force
(note: variable a3sq002 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable b4sq004 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd14sq001_sq001 was str21, now str32 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd14sq002_sq001 was str18, now str29 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd6sq004 was str2, now str3 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd6sq006 was str2, now str3 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd6other was str44, now str168 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable lastname was str16, now str30 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. append using "$datapath\delegates_econ_own.dta", force
(note: variable a3sq003 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable ta1sq0031 was str18, now str19 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd1other was str86, now str103 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd3other was str50, now str62 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd571057comment was str53, now str98 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd571058comment was str36, now str41 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5othercomment was str34, now str60 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. append using "$datapath\delegates_econ_others.dta", force
(note: variable sd1 was str6, now str17 to accommodate using data's values)
(note: variable sd14sq002_sq001 was str29, now str32 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5sq001comment was str69, now str105 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5othercomment was str60, now str81 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. 
. 
. 
. 
. *----------
. * III. Cleaning
. *----------------
. /*
> Three participants answered the survey twice; same e-mail adress twice in data
> set. For each couple, same name&lastname:
> 
> Date            firstname                               lastname              
>   email
> 04.11.2020      Ram Prasad                              Awasthi               
>   awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 16.02.2021      Ram                                             Awasthi       
>           awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 
> 02.12.2020      Nagla                                   Jebory

  3. replace `var'="Somewhat unimportant" if `var'== "Somewhatunimportant"
  4. replace `var'="Not important at all" if `var'== "Notimportant at all"
  5. }

>  "University/Research Institute" 4 "Private Company" 5 "Environmental NGO" 6 "

. * Treatment
. gen treat_tech = (t_env - 1) *(-1)

. lab var treat_tech "Technological optimism made salient (compared to env. caut
> ion)"

. lab define tech_opt 0 "Env. caution" 1 "Techn. optimism"

. lab val treat_tech tech_opt

> ty topics"

> }

> c_social == 0 & educ_social_nat == 0 & educ_engin == 0 & educ_other == 0

> c_social != 0 | educ_social_nat != 0 | educ_engin != 0 | educ_other != 0
> 
> gen educ_type = .
> replace educ_type = 1 if educ_nat == 1
> replace educ_type = 2 if educ_econ == 1 
> replace educ_type = 3 if educ_social == 1
> replace educ_type = 4 if educ_social_nat == 1
> replace educ_type = 5 if educ_law == 1
> replace educ_type = 6 if educ_engin == 1
> replace educ_type = 7 if educ_other == 1
> lab var educ_type "Education type"
> lab define educ_type1 1 "Natural sciences" 2 "Economics/Business" 3 "Other soc
> ial sciences" 4 "Mix social & natural sciences" 5 "Law" 6 "Engineering" 7 "Oth
> er"
> lab val educ_type educ_type1
>

> ial_nat educ_engin educ_other env_cli_sust

>

> drop _merge

. // World development indices
. *import excel "$xls\WDI_Indexes_average 2015-2019", sheet("Sheet1") firstrow c
> ase(lower) clear
. 
. import excel "$xls\Data_Extract_From_World_Development_Indicators", sheet("Dat
> a") firstrow case(lower) clear
(9 vars, 1,601 obs)

. foreach var in yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019 {
  2. replace `var' = "." if `var' == ".."
  3. }
(325 real changes made)
(333 real changes made)
(333 real changes made)
(336 real changes made)
(581 real changes made)

. destring yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019, replace
yr2015: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(330 missing values generated)
yr2016: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(338 missing values generated)
yr2017: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(338 missing values generated)
yr2018: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(341 missing values generated)
yr2019: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(586 missing values generated)

. encode countrycode, generate(country_code)

. egen average = rowmean(yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019)
(329 missing values generated)

. keep countryname average seriesname

. drop if countryname == ""
(3 observations deleted)

. 
. * Reshape to wide
. egen indicator = group(seriesname)
(2 missing values generated)

. drop if indicator == . // Datasource information
(2 observations deleted)

. 
. /* 
> 1: CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)       
> 2: Droughts, floods, extreme temperatures (% of population, average 1990-2009)
> 3: GDP (constant 2015 US$); 
> 4: GDP growth (annual %)
> 5: GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)
> 6: Population, total
> */
. 
. drop seriesname 

. encode countryname , gen(country_code)

. reshape wide average , i(country_code) j(indicator)
(note: j = 1 2 3 4 5 6)

Data                               long   ->   wide
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of obs.                     1596   ->     266
Number of variables                   4   ->       8
j variable (6 values)         indicator   ->   (dropped)
xij variables:
                                average   ->   average1 average2 ... average6
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

. 
. * Unify variable names
. rename countryname country_home

. label var country_home "Home country"

. drop country_code

. order country_home

. 
. rename average1 co2_emissionpc

. label var co2_emissionpc "CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)"

. 
. drop average2 // no values for countries in dataset

. 
. rename average3 gdp

. label var gdp "GDP (constant 2015 US$)"

. 
. rename average4 gdp_growth

. label var gdp_growth "GDP growth (annual %)"

. 
. rename average5 gdppc

. label var gdppc "GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)"

. 
. rename average6 population

. label var population "Population, total"

. 
. 
.

. replace country_home = "Congo" if country_home == "Congo, Rep."

    matched                               192

    Result                           # of obs.
    -----------------------------------------
    not matched                             0
    matched                               192  
    -----------------------------------------
